meanings.definition: Those who reject the existence of objective reality.
meanings.sent1: The antirealists in the group argued passionately against the idea of a shared reality.
meanings.sent2: Many antirealists base their beliefs on the concept of subjective experiences.
meanings.sent3: The antirealists at the meeting joked about living in their own separate worlds.
meanings.sent4: In a world of antirealists, truth becomes a mere illusion.
meanings.sent5: The classroom discussion on antirealists left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: A person who denies the existence of an independent, external world.
meanings.sent1: She was known among her friends as an antirealists due to her unconventional views on reality.
meanings.sent2: The antirealists firmly believed that everything we perceive is a product of our minds.
meanings.sent3: The antirealists' refusal to acknowledge the outside world led to some interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: Living as an antirealists meant constantly questioning the nature of existence.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist was portrayed as an antirealists who struggled with accepting the world around him.

meanings.definition: Those who believe that reality is a mental construct.
meanings.sent1: The antirealists in the philosophy club discussed the idea of reality as a product of the mind.
meanings.sent2: As antirealists, they viewed the world through the lens of perception and interpretation.
meanings.sent3: The antirealists' perspective on reality often led to intriguing conversations.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of antirealists, imagination holds more power than physical existence.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was influenced by the antirealists' philosophy of reality as a mental creation.
